intro: Stapfiella zambesiensis f. zambesiensis, commonly known as the Zambesi stapfiella, is a rare and unique plant species native to specific regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many milkweed-like plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
